subject: Scheme Discussion Packet, Problem 6.3 Help
content:
I am confused about the implementation to 6.3 from the Scheme DIscussion Packet. In the line that says

(+ (label tree) (sum (map tree-sum (branches tree))))) 

I don't understand why we call the map function on (tree-sum (branches tree)) instead of just doing 

(sum (tree-sum (branches tree)))))

threads.content: tree-sum takes in a "tree" as an argument. (branches tree) is a list of trees not a single tree. In order to apply tree-sum to every single branch, we need to use map function

threads.question: oh that makes sense, thank you!
